titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Will Clayton Papers, 1896-1990
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1997 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Will Clayton Papers,
did.abstract: Correspondence, interview transcripts, speeches and writings, memoranda, notes, printed matter, and photographs, relating to post-World War II American foreign policy, especially formulation of the Marshall Plan, international trade policy, and Atlantic unity; the cotton industry; and family affairs. Includes original family correspondence, especially between Will Clayton and his fiancee Susan Vaughan, 1897-1902; copies of State Department documents and other papers; and papers of Ellen Garwood, daughter and biographer of Will Clayton, relating to her father.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Will Clayton papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1988.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Co-founder, Anderson, Clayton & Co., Houston, Texas
Member, Committee on Cotton Distribution, War Industries Board
Undersecretary of State for Economic Affairs
Head, U.S. Delegation, United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment, Havana, Cuba
Author, We Must Trade Sovereignty for Freedom
Author, We Are Losing the Cold War
Chairman, National Committee on Campaign Contributions and Expenditures
Co-Chairman, U.S. Citizens Commission on NATO

did.unittitle: BIOGRAPHICAL FILE, 1799-1986.

scopecontent.p: Notes, biographical sketches, itineraries, clippings, correspondence, legal documents, and genealogy, certificate, printed material, resolutions, correspondence, printed articles, serial issues, list, speeches newsletter, pamphlets, programs, and miscellany. Arranged alphabetically by form.

did.unittitle: SPEECHES AND WRITINGS, 1925-1986.

scopecontent.p: Typescript and printed copies, serial issues, notes, interviews conducted by Ellen Clayton Garwood, press releases, memoranda, correspondence, and clippings. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: CORRESPONDENCE, 1896-1978.

scopecontent.p: Family and professional correspondence of William L. Clayton, sympathy letters, and correspondence of Mrs. Ellen Clayton Garwood, primarily relating to her biography of her father. Arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

did.unittitle: ELLEN CLAYTON GARWOOD BIOGRAPHICAL FILE, 1953-1989.

scopecontent.p: Printed articles, clippings, correspondence, promotional material, and miscellany. Primarily relates to Ellen Clayton Garwood's biography of her father. Arranged alphabetically by form.

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1898-1990.

scopecontent.p: Clippings, pamphlets, printed articles, leaflets, programs, speeches, newsletters, notes, serial issues, reports, correspondence, lists, memoranda, bulletins, oral history interviews, position papers, book reviews, and miscellany. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: AUDIOVISUAL FILE, c. 1899-c. 1960.

scopecontent.p: See photo card catalog for description
